We ran a transparent process to identify these projects, listing them on my website for the last several weeks for public input and accountability.

I'll do all I can to see these through as the bills move to the Senate, and to keep clawing back funds to help our district.

It will help Union County build radio towers that police and fire departments need to communicate better, Readington build proper storage & maintenance facilities for its public works department, and Warren Community College establish an agriculture education program.

The funding will help Somerville build a grass baseball/softball field, soccer field, picnic area and basketball court at Chambers Park, much needed as more young families move into town, and Garwood resurface streets leading to its train station.

The projects include urgently needed water, sewer, and drainage improvements in Clinton, Berkeley Heights, Milford, and Wharton, and a pedestrian walkway connecting Bernardsville's train station with a residential community.

My team and I worked with mayors and county officials across our district to find ten shovel-ready projects that will help our communities and create jobs.
